head.title: Milking It for All It's Worth

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New Jersey

hedline.hl1: Milking It for All It's Worth

abstract.p: Cow Parade, unusual summerlong art exhibition of life-size fiberglass cows, is set to open in West Orange, NJ (S)

block.p: Anyone who is not sick of bovine-related wordplay already will probably be soon: West Orange officially opens ''Cow Parade,'' an unusual summerlong art exhibition, on Friday, and the puns are piling up.

For weeks artists have been decorating 28 life-size fiberglass cows that will be displayed around town. New York has a similar enterprise under way. It's all an attempt to duplicate a fund-raising and publicity gimmick that succeeded in Chicago and elsewhere.

Anyone who is not sick of bovine-related wordplay already will probably be soon: West Orange officially opens ''Cow Parade,'' an unusual summerlong art exhibition, on Friday, and the puns are piling up.

For weeks artists have been decorating 28 life-size fiberglass cows that will be displayed around town. New York has a similar enterprise under way. It's all an attempt to duplicate a fund-raising and publicity gimmick that succeeded in Chicago and elsewhere.

The problem is, the very mention of cows seems to send the human wordplay gene into overdrive. ''West Orange Wrangles a Prime Art Show'' is typical of recent headlines, and the headline writers are outdone only by the organizers themselves.

Thus Friday's festivities include a ''Cattle Call'' at the Essex Green promenade from 9 to 11 a.m. (featuring a ''mootricious breakfast''), an evening ''Hoe-Down and Hullaba-moo'' at Town Hall and the kickoff of a ''Read Till the Cows Come Home'' program. The cows will be on exhibit through Sept. 4.
